alert.note: Alert for Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 7:47AM EST until February 05 at 4:40PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...Habersham and Rabun Counties. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 747 AM EST, Between 4.5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen for this event and scattered flooding is ongoing across the advised area. Flooding includes, but is not limited to, the Tallulah and Soque Rivers and select tributaries. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Clayton, Clarkesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Alto, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Tallulah Falls, Lake Rabun, Lakemont, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Lake Burton, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Raoul and Seed Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
